meanings.definition: A group or company of people.
meanings.sent1: The segge of friends gathered around the campfire.
meanings.sent2: The segge of students walked to school together.
meanings.sent3: The segge of ducks waddled in a line behind their mother.
meanings.sent4: The segge of stars twinkled brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The segge of ants worked together to carry a large crumb.

meanings.sent1: She will segge the secret to her best friend.
meanings.sent2: I segge 'hello' every time I see my neighbor.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to segge a few words after listening to the family.
meanings.sent4: His eyes segge the truth even when his words do not.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to segge a mysterious message through the trees.
